channel.title: Ethic for broadcasting
channel.description:
This series presents interviews that center on issues in broadcasting and society.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Lawmaker of the art, part 2
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, focuses on the legal aspects of television and its programming.
item.dc:creator: Cambis, John
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Critic of the art, part 1
item.description: This program, the first of three parts, focuses on criticisms of television programming.
item.dc:creator: Cambis, John
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Advertiser of the art, part 2
item.description: This program, the second of two parts, focuses on advertisement in television.
item.dc:creator: Cambis, John
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Audience for the art, part 1
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, asks if the audience is really there for more thoughtful media output.
item.dc:creator: Cambis, John
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Advertiser of the art, part 1

item.title: Crisis in communication: Introduction
item.description: This program presents an introduction to the series.
item.dc:creator: Cambis, John
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Summary and conclusions
item.description: This program provides a summary for the series and offers some conclusions.
